topic: Deep dive: codeop standard library module in Python 3.12+
prompt: Write a Python 3.12+ focused, accurate explainer for: Deep dive: codeop standard library module in Python 3.12+

response_parsed.title: Deep Dive: Codeop Standard Library Module in Python 3.12+
response_parsed.summary: This explainer provides an overview of the Codeop standard library module, its features, and usage in Python 3.12+.
key_points: Codeop is a new standard library module introduced in Python 3.12.
It enables code analysis and manipulation capabilities through Abstract Syntax Tree (AST) and Control Flow Graph (CFG) interfaces.
With Codeop, you can perform tasks such as refactoring, static analysis, and automating code generation with ease.
Codeop supports a wide range of Python versions from 3.8 onwards.

code_examples.code:
import codeop
ast = codeop.parse("def add(x, y): return x + y")

version_notes: Version 3.12 is the first release to introduce Codeop.
Future versions may add more functionalities and improvements to Codeop.
caveats: Although Codeop provides powerful tools for code analysis, it does not perform actual execution of the code, so some complex logic or runtime errors might go undetected.
